thread.title_full: People Are Least Satisfied With Life in These U.S. Cities

title: People Are Least Satisfied With Life in These U.S. Cities
text:
People Are Least Satisfied With Life in These U.S. Cities Written by: Caroline Nolan 07/18/15 - 2:17 PM EDT 
NEW YORK (TheStreet) -- What is it about Ohio and why are people there the least satisfied with life?We looked at the most recent Gallup-Healthways Well-Being Index , and of the 25 major cities in the U.S. where the people are the least satisfied, seven are located in Ohio.According to the report, "well-being is correlated with healthcare utilization and cost as well as productivity measures like absenteeism, presenteeism and job performance - all critical to organizational and economic competitiveness."Researchers randomly interviewed 176,702 adults across all 50 states throughout 2014. They then translated this data into five elements: 
- Purpose, liking what you do each day and being motivated to achieve your goals- Social, having supportive relationships and love in your life- Financial, managing your economic life to reduce stress and increase security- Community, liking where you live, feeling safe and having pride in your community- Physical, having good health and enough energy to get things done daily 
Of those five elements, people in the following 25 U.S. cities scored the lowest. Click through to see if your city made the list. More Headlines
